intro: Piratinera acutifolia, commonly known as the acute-leaved piratinera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with sharply pointed lobes and produces showy, pink to purple flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
